title: (x) West End Wine Shop - Historical Fell Type {Metadox}
content:
... if you know what it is. I've looked around and around and can't seem to find it. Thanks!   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014092910im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/42994.jpg)
author: alan

comments.content:
Damn, I thought for sure it was ITC Founder's Caslon. Close (especially the long bottom horizontal on the E) but no cigar.   
   
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-founders-caslon/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014092910/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-founders-caslon/)
Pretty sure it's Hoefler's [Historical Fell Type](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014092910/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/historicals/testdriver/fellsc.html) (regular & small caps).

Brilliant, it is Fell Type. Blast! I remember the last time I posted a type ID here, someone told me to always check Hoefler first. This time, I thought for sure he didn't have anything like that. But I forgot completely about the historic allsorts. Thanks!
